intro: Capparis pumila, commonly known as the dwarf caper, is a low-growing shrub native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. It features small, thorny stems and produces clusters of white or yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is characterized by its pungent, edible berries, which are often used in culinary applications. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Capparis pumila thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
